title: Great for the most part
text: With some exceptions (I‚Äôm looking at you Word), when it comes to their office products on Apple platforms, Microsoft tends to execute a few steps short of perfectly. But those short steps can be chew-through-your-workdesk-annoying. The iOS Outlook app has a solid user interface. It‚Äôs quite stable and doesn‚Äôt have a lot of bugs. When it comes to reading and composing emails, it does what it‚Äôs supposed to do. But a few (what some would see as minor) things are incredibly annoying. Why in the world can‚Äôt I customize my font when composing emails? This seems like an easy feature to provide. Why is it 2024 and we can‚Äôt get our email signatures to look the way we want them to look? And don‚Äôt get me started with trying to include images in them. Again, a few steps short of perfect. Works well, but wish they would give some more attention to those steps.

title: Outlook Review
text: Outlook is a great tool for sending emails professionally and it is connected to many other Microsoft apps which I like. The only reason I have it one star is because it doesn‚Äôt show notifications so I must constantly look in the app to see if someone has emailed me. Otherwise, I definitely recommend Outlook!

title: Not respecting quiet mode
text: Outlook is not following my quiet mode time anymore. It‚Äôs sending me push notifications for emails even when quiet mode is enabled.

title: Contacts
text: Outlook mobile is awesome except for the contacts. Wish we could view them better.

title: Update adds advertisements that look like emails
text:
Previously, this was my go-to email app for iPhone for 6+ years. It has a lot of functionality wrapped into one app and was free. With a new update, they have added advertisements to the email pane that look identical to regular emails, purposely made to mislead individuals into clicking them. I can half understand the need to monetize a free product but this is an unacceptable implementation and I'll be moving on from this point.

Hope to see an update in the future to remove this and maybe Microsoft can look for a better way to monetize their product instead of intending to mislead their user base.

title: Desperately need a way to totally block senders
text:
I am swamped on IOS Outlook app with spam and unwanted senders. Outlook does not have any way to totally block senders. All users desperately need to be able to do this. 

Come on developers, help us out.

title: No ToDo lists in app
text:
This could be a fantastic mobile version of the desktop app. Unfortunately, they left out one HUGE feature from Outlook‚Ä¶ the To Do list. 

For some insane reason, they make you download a separate app just for tasks. Even though tasks do appear in the desktop app. 

Tasks have due dates, which means they should be in the same app as the calendar, so we can manage our agenda each day without having to flip back-and-forth between two apps.

It works this way in the desktop version of Outlook, so why do they force us to be less productive on mobile? Crazy.

title: Please adopt iPadOS system and other features to make it productive
text: Outlook should 1) adopt iPadOS‚Äôs multi-window features; 2) formatting an email should have more features; 3) saving in an email attachment into OneDrive should a matter of just dragging and dropping (I get an error message); and 4) it should allow users to save attachments in other SharePoint sites than only the personal OneDrive account.

title: Great app for mobile, needs Vision Pro Native
text:
First and foremost, thank you for making such a great mobile experience. This is my go to app for email. It supports all of my various personal and work accounts seamlessly.

For Vision Pro, please release a native application. Currently, Outlook will not allow me to open M365 attachments in the Naive Vision Pro applications. This would be a fantastic capability.

Related, but not to Outlook, please provide access to OneDrive in either a compatibility app, or on native Vision Pro. The lack of this feature is making workflows challenging on the Vision Pro.

title: The best email app !!
text: Outlook stands out as the epitome of excellence in email management. Surpassing even the standard Apple Mail app, it offers unparalleled ease of navigation, efficient email flagging, marking as unread, and seamless email responses. Its intuitive user interface and streamlined user experience unequivocally establish it as the premier choice among email applications.
